Definition at line 122 of file type.hpp.

template<typename TYPE>
template<typename T>
isis::util::Type< TYPE >::Type ( const T &  value  )  [inline]

Create a Type from any type of value-type.

If the type of the parameter is not the same as the content type of the object, the system tries to do a type conversion. If that fails, boost::bad_lexical_cast is thrown.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename TYPE>
TypeBase* isis::util::Type< TYPE >::clone (  )  const [inline, protected, virtual]

Create a copy of this.

Creates a new Type/TypePtr an stores a copy of its value there. Makes TypeBase-pointers copyable without knowing their type.

Returns:
a TypeBase-pointer to a newly created Type/TypePtr.

Definition at line 186 of file type.hpp.

template<typename TYPE>
isis::util::Type< TYPE >::operator const TYPE & (  )  const [inline]

Implicit conversion of Type to its value type.

Only the actual type is allowed. However, the following is valid: 

 Type<int> i(5);
 float f=i;
In this case the function returns int which is then also implicitely converted to float.
Returns:
the stored value
